appearance.company_name.name: Company Name Display
appearance.company_name.description: Enables or disables the display of the company name in the interface.

appearance.logo.name: Custom Logo
appearance.logo.description: Allows for the addition of a custom logo in the interface.

appearance.privacy_policy_redirect.name: Privacy Policy Redirect
appearance.privacy_policy_redirect.description: Enables a redirect to a privacy policy page on the Scheduling component.

appearance.show_autoschedule.name: Auto-Schedule Option
appearance.show_autoschedule.description: Provides an option for invitees to connect and share their calendar for mutual availability to be shown.

appearance.show_week_view.name: Week View
appearance.show_week_view.description: Enables a week view in calendar displays.

appearance.thank_you_redirect.name: Booking Confirmed (Thank You) Redirect
appearance.thank_you_redirect.description: Redirects users to a specified URL after submission. This can be done with eventOverrides in our Scheduling component.

booking.additional_fields.name: Additional Booking Fields
booking.additional_fields.description: Enables extra fields in the booking form. Until the Nylas-hosted solution is surfaced, there will be no Editor support - forms are buildable between the Scheduling component's slots.

booking.additional_guests_hidden.name: Additional Guest Options on Scheduling Page

booking.available_days_in_future.name: Days Into the Future Available for Booking

booking.cancellation_policy.name: Cancellation Policy
booking.cancellation_policy.description: This is the cancellation message/policy that organizers can configure from the Editor. It shows up on cancellation flows to end-users.

booking.confirmation_method.automatic.name: Automatic Booking Confirmation
booking.confirmation_method.automatic.description: Bookings are confirmed automatically without host intervention.

booking.conferencing.name: Auto-Conferencing üÜï
booking.conferencing.description: Out-of-the-box conferencing with the same provider you're authenticated with, as well as support for passing cross-provider grants (ie. Zoom, Teams) to enable auto-conferencing to those providers.

booking.slot_logic.name: Intuitive time slot logic üÜï
booking.slot_logic.description: Out-of-the-box Editor support for setting interval and basic rounding of time slots. Previously, this was only in the API.

booking.hide_flows.name: Enable / disable cancel or reschedule flows üÜï
booking.hide_flows.description: Out-of-the-box Editor and API support to hide both the cancel and reschedule options from appearing in emails or the Scheduling component.

event.template_title.name: Event Titles (with templating support)
event.template_title.description: We refurbished this, giving you more intuitive placeholder to make dynamic titles.

webhooks.bookings_pending.name: Pending Bookings
webhooks.bookings_pending.description: Pendings bookings are bookings which either need manual confirmation from the organizer, or that need custom confirmation from any other business logic through the PUT /bookings endpoint.

expire_after.date.name: Expire at Date
expire_after.date.description: Can be done with web components now, as they can be gated any way a developer wishes. Pages can also be deleted through our CRUD endpoints. Scheduler webhooks (new to V3) can help these flows.

expire_after.uses.name: Expire After Uses
expire_after.uses.description: Can be done with web components now, as they can be gated any way a developer wishes. Pages can also be deleted through our CRUD endpoints. Scheduler webhooks (new to V3) can help these flows.

features.change_name_url_parameter.name: Change Name URL Parameter
features.change_name_url_parameter.description: Allows the name to be changed via a URL parameter.

features.collective_meetings.name: Collective Meetings
features.collective_meetings.description: Along with API support (available since the Early Access milestone), this will give Developers the ability to pass a list of Nylas-auth'ed users to the Editor; this gives Organizers the ability to select from those users if they wish to consider availability across participants, and add others to their meetings.

features.group_meetings.name: Group Meetings
features.group_meetings.description: We plan to fast-follow after GA to have a superior group meeting experience than in v2. We want to do this right the first time.

migration.name: Scheduler v2 page & slug migration üèóÔ∏è
migration.description: [Opt-in] When a scheduling page is loaded in v3 with a slug, a page-fetching attempt is made for the given app_id in v3. If the slug doesn't exist in v3, v2 is checked, and the page is migrated automatically if it exists. From that point on, it is a v3 page. Note that some pages may fail to migrate due to complexities. They will then have to be re-created by end-users.
